basics.name: Nick Scherman
basics.label: Application Developer
basics.summary: Enterprise web developer with full stack experience skilled in front end frameworks, microservices application development, requirements gathering, communication and design.

work.summary: Development lead for a banking application. Working in one of the bank's first agile teams. Extensive requirements gathering, documenting, development and teamwork. Developing front end components (using Angular), microservices (Nodejs) and updating legacy applications (Portals) to work with the new technology.
highlights: Full stack development using future looking design patterns (JS frameworks, microservices)
Requirements gathering, solutioning and communicating directly with business decision makers
Responsible for managing daily builds to the SIT environment producing release notes and managing Jira for the development team
Responsible for performing code reviews and maintaining overall code quality for project release candidate
Maintenence and updating of legacy portal applications

work.summary: Jam3 is a production company delivering unique digital experiences with a focus and innovative UI/UX. Developers work with designers to create unique interactive experiences through web browsers and other mediums.
highlights: Developed user interfaces and development frameworks for new and existing projects
Created extensible libraries using NPM for use in projects (React/Redux, Threejs/Webgl)
Created Electron cross-platform applications and Chrome extensions and native applications with Crosswalk and React native
Development lead on small project for Canadian Blood services
Research and development creating Machine-learning web services.
Significant contributions to many projects including Mustang Customizer (www.mustangcustomizer.com) and Vikings (vikings.history.co.uk)

work.summary: Intermediate Application developers at CIBC are responsible for working with existing applications and providing solutions to application issues as they arise as well as maintaining and updating application code.
highlights: Implemented features in java for update of internal application.
Created runbooks for the migration of the Development and User-Acceptance Testing (UAT) application servers Â– including gap-analysis and solutions for software updated with the migration.
Management of development and UAT servers
Honourable Mention for the Summer 2015 student achievement award.

work.summary: DPS907/WSA500 is a class focusing on developing resilient and secure RESTful web services using C# and asp.net. The course focuses on the foundations of web services including Model/Resource relationships, Security and Deployment of web APIs.
highlights: Provided feedback and input on the development of future course material
Metal fabrication and blue print interpretation

education.summary: The Seneca College school of ICT has a well developed and reputable programming department that focuses on teaching a range of fundamental and advanced programming techniques including data structures and algorithms, database design and general and specialized software development. Students have the opportunity to take part in co operative education and to contribute to open source technology at the prestigious Centre for Development of Open Technology.

The University of Waterloo Arts program provides a strong foundation for research and critical thinking skills as well as business communication skills that are applicable on a daily basis in my work environment
